article_title: Rick Santorum is not happy with mercury regulations
article_text:
Tweets from https://twitter.com/politico/lists/debate-night-w-politico The 2016 Blast The latest POLITICO scoops and coverage of the 2016 elections. Email Sign Up Tweets from https://twitter.com/politico/lists/2016-candidates

Rick Santorum also complained about ozone regulations. Santorum slams mercury regulations

Rick Santorum trashed excessive government taxes and regulations, including those regulating mercury.

"It's not just taxes. It's regulation," he said. "I pledge to cut every single Obamacare — Obama regulation, including Obamacare, and remove those regulations that cost more than $100 million in the economy."

The former Pennsylvania senator then ticked through a list of what he characterized as crushing regulations.

"That will liberate, and that includes [Waters of the United States], and the ozone regulations, the mercury regulations, all of these just crush our manufacturers and don't create an opportunity for us to survive," he said. "And remember, China produces five times as much CO2 and other pollutants per dollar of GDP as we do. You want to help the environment, bring jobs back to America."

og.description: The candidate said it's one of the regulations holding back the economy.
